12 Reasons Why Blue Ivy Will Be the Perfect Big Sister 
Free red carpet training, awesome photoshoots and an incredible stash of hand-me-downs. Getty By Erica Gonzales Feb 1, 2017 
This afternoon, Beyoncé announced the glorious news that she's expecting twins , which means her five-year-old daughter Blue Ivy Carter is going to be a big sister for the first time ever. Being a child of Beyoncé and Jay Z carries its own perks, but so does having Blue as an older sister. Below, browse all the reasons why the two new Carters will be lucky to be under her wing. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below She'll train them for the red carpet 
From the CFDAs (pictured here) to the VMAs, she's had a lot of experience walking the carpet, for a five-year-old. She'll probably pass down her wisdom to her two new siblings once they start taking their first steps. Getty She'll give them great lessons in style 
The Carter twins are bound to receive the most epic hand-me-downs, including this $11,000 dress Blue wore to the VMAs in 2016. Getty Advertisement - Continue Reading Below They'll probably do a bunch of adorable photoshoots together 
Though photoshoots in the garage may be Beyoncé's thing, Blue Ivy has quickly inherited the hobby and joined in with her mom for a few snaps. Surely, she'll have her siblings join in and do the same. Beyonce.com She'll make them dress up in matching outfits 
Mini Gucci outfits in sets of three? Yes, please. Beyonce.com Advertisement - Continue Reading Below She'll introduce them to all their famous aunts and uncles 
In addition to having cool blood relatives like Solange, Blue is also close with celebs like Rihanna and Gwyneth Paltrow. (Imagine the birthday gift possibilities.) Getty She'll defend them from the paparazzi 
When the toddler and her parents arrived at the CFDA Awards, she waved her finger and faced the paparazzi with one message: "No pictures." If Beyoncé and Jay Z plan on keeping their newborns' identity private, Blue will make a great security guard. Getty Advertisement - Continue Reading Below She'll share music video cameos with them 
After showing off her moves in "Formation," the tot may want backup for future music video appearances. Beyonce.com She'll give them great advice on Halloween costumes 
Halloween of 2016 taught us that Blue Ivy is great at group costumes . When her two siblings arrive, she'll replace her parents with her new dress-up buddies. Beyonce / Instagram Advertisement - Continue Reading Below They'll be a great addition to her squad 
Blue's brunch squad includes godmother Gwyneth Paltrow's kids, but they can always welcome some more members. Gwyneth Paltrow / Instagram She'll sneak them into Beyoncé's rehearsals 
Blue has a lifetime backstage pass for Beyoncé performances, which means being behind the scenes for practices and performances from the Super Bowl to the Formation tour. Sneaking into rehearsals will be much more fun with two new members of the family. Beyonce / Instagram
